item.title: Battlefield 6 Beta: Warning or Win?
item.description: What does the Battlefield 6 Open Beta show us about the full launch of the game? What is great about the game in its current state, what could use some fixing, and finally are fans excited? Today on Game Rant let's break all three of those questions down.

item.title: PSA: Battlefield 6 Beta Players Who Missed Early Access Can't Ignore This Feature
item.description:
Battlefield 6 's first beta is currently underway, with those who have been able to snag an early access code being among the first to experience it before it opens up to all players on August 9. What this means, though, is that those who have been participating in early access for Battlefield 6 's beta are now more experienced and higher ranked than those who are either waiting for things to open up or simply haven't taken the necessary steps to obtain an early access code. Fortunately, Battlefield 6 has a great feature to help those who have now fallen behind still find their footing without getting dominated by those with a couple of days' experience under their belts.

Among the available playlists in Battlefield 6 's open beta is one that is easy to scroll past but could end up being key to a newcomer's entire beta experience. Those who are new to the Battlefield series or are jumping into Battlefield 6 's open beta at the last minute can benefit from this mode, as it offers a space where the learning curve feels manageable instead of overwhelming. For those coming in after early access, that difference can be huge. It gives time to adjust, learn the systems, and find a rhythm without immediately facing squads that have already spent hours refining their gameplay. That playlist is Breakthrough Initiation.

Battlefield 6's Breakthrough Initiation Mode Is Perfect for Beta Newcomers

Breakthrough Initiation's Career Rank Cap Grants a Safe On-Ramp

At first glance, Breakthrough Initiation might look like nothing more than a glorified tutorial for one of the Battlefield franchise's staple game modes, but it has some limits applied to it that can make it a safe on-ramp for new players, both to the current beta and to the series as a whole. Rather than simply throwing players into the deep end and hoping they swim as Battlefield has done in the past, Battlefield 6 locks players higher than Career Rank 15 out of Breakthrough Initiation.

Anyone who has played a previous Battlefield beta can likely remember those first few matches dominated by highly coordinated squads who already knew the map layouts and class advantages, and Breakthrough Initiation's rules essentially protect them from that. By walling off the mode from experienced players, Breakthrough Initiation effectively contains the tryhards to other playlists while newer players build up their confidence and learn the ropes. But it's not just important to new players either, as it makes it more satisfying for Battlefield veterans who want a real competition, urging them to move on once they've hit a certain rank in Battlefield 6 .

Breakthrough Initiation Represents a New Philosophy for Battlefield

Again, this is a huge blessing for newcomers, as Battlefield has never been known for its gentle onboarding. Whether players started with Bad Company 2 or 2042 , chances are their early matches were chaotic, punishing, and often overwhelming. The series as a whole has thus relied more on the cinematic spectacle of Battlefield and its more experienced squads to help new players with their first steps, but that often left solo newcomers to fend for themselves. Battlefield 6 's Breakthrough Initiation mode changes that, and players coming into the beta late would be remiss not to take advantage of its boundaries.

Breakthrough Initiation may not grab attention on the playlist screen, but for anyone hopping into Battlefield 6 's beta after early access, it could be the difference between frustration and actually learning something. By giving players a space where the learning curve feels fair, they have a real chance to settle in before taking on the wider chaos of Battlefield 6 's beta. If nothing else, this could be the start of a major turning point for the series in terms of accessibility.

item.title: All S.A.M. File Locations & Puzzle Solution in Reckoning (Black Ops 6 Zombies)
item.description:
For players who have accessed the T2 Teleportation Lab as part of Reckoning's main easter egg, they might be stuck on uncovering the next piece of the puzzle, that puzzle being a 4-digit password that is required to access one of the Project Janus computers near Franken-Klaus. If players are struggling with the puzzle and want to know the solution, along with all potential spawns of the items needed for the puzzle itself, then look below to find everything you need to proceed with this Black Ops 6 easter egg.

Where to Find All SAM Files (Documents) in Reckoning

Players are looking for 4 documents that can be found in the Reckoning map, and luckily, there's a set amount of locations in which these objects can spawn. There are a total of 7 spawns that the S.A.M. Files can be found in, so they've all been listed below:

SAM File Location

Inside the T2 Teleportation Lab at the central terminal

On a wooden table in the T1 Executive Suite, noted by having 3 chairs around it

On a coffee table in the west corner of the T1 Executive Suite, the one with a toppled-over lamp and chair

On the reception desk upstairs in the T1 Executive Suite

On the left side of Richtofen's desk in the T1 Director's Office

Underneath the TV monitor on a shelf at the south wall within the T1 Director's Office

On a white table next to the blueprints of S.A.M. at the southwest wall in the T1 Director's Office

How to Solve the SAM Files Puzzle in Reckoning

Once players have found the 4 SAM Files in their specific game, they will want to know what they are looking for. Players will want to look at the first two lines of the file. The first line specifies a number next to the item's name, and the second line specifies the date on which it was archived. For instance, if players have "1. Notso's Collar" then there is a "1" within the password, and the date "Archived: 7/15/1985" indicates what order in the sequence players will enter the number "1". In order to find your sequence, make a list of the artifact numbers and set them in date order from the earliest date to the latest date. For example, we had the following numbers, so in date order, they would look like this:

  • 6. (6/28/1985)
  • 1. (7/15/1985)
  • 5. (10/12/1985)
  • 2. (12/8/1985)

This means that the password in our game was 6152, which we can enter into the computer terminal in the T2 Teleportation Lab. So, just to clarify, the password number is the first line, and the order sequence is based on the date, with January being first and December being last. Here's the raw information on every SAM File so players can look at the images instead of reading the text:

Artifact

Password Number

Date

BND Badge

6

6/28/1985

Notso's Collar

1

7/15/1985

Scarf

3

8/21/1985

Wristwatch

4

9/2/1985

Combat Goggles

5

10/12/1985

Katana

2

12/8/1985

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: A Calculated Evolution Guide (Password Puzzle Solution)
item.description:
Main scenario quests in Final Fantasy 14 usually aren't that hard to complete, even if they challenge you with a dungeon or trial. There are a few exceptions, though, and A Calculated Evolution is stumping a lot of players trying to finish the Patch 7.3 MSQ to see the next chapter of Final Fantasy XIV 's Dawntrail expansion.

A Calculated Evolution is a mostly straightforward quest, but there's a puzzle near the end that requires players to decipher a password for the director's terminal. There are a few things that you need to check in order to find the solution, so you can't progress unless you look in the exact right spots. Here's how to solve the password puzzle and complete A Calculated Evolution in Final Fantasy 14.

A Calculated Evolution Password Answer

A Calculated Evolution is a simple quest until the very end, where you're required to input a password into the director's terminal in order to complete the mission. The answer to the puzzle isn't very far from the terminal itself, but the hints the game gives you can be misinterpreted, leading you to the wrong answer.

The password to the director's terminal in A Calculated Evolution is Honesty , Devotion , Protection . The key to the puzzle lies in the three colored jewels on display next to the terminal. After speaking to everyone in the room and interacting with everything you can, you'll be able to slot in a green piece of alexandrite next to the existing garnet and sapphire.

A scrawled phrase at the bottom of the frame instructs you to " heed the stones ," and you'll be reminded that Alexandrians have special meanings for gemstones. Talk to Sphene, and she'll explain what each of them represents. Each gem also corresponds to a different room, so if you combine all the information you have, you can deduce the passwords for the protolab, deuterolab, and director's office.

After this puzzle, you can complete A Calculated Evolution and continue on with the rest of Patch 7.3's main scenario quests. It's a great conclusion to a lot of Dawntrail 's story arcs, and there's even more to see after the main story is over. You can try to get some of the new Final Fantasy 14 mounts and minions from the Vault Oneiron Treasure Dungeon, for example.

Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail

item.title: All Character Locations in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4
item.description:
Gamers will find various characters on the Fortnite Battle Royale island, and each one provides a set of services that can be helpful during a match. This is why it's important for players to talk to each character as soon as they're introduced so they can complete the Fortnite NPC Collection and have it as a resource whenever they start a game. This way, they know who's close to their current location and if they're worth talking to before moving on to the next looting spot.

If players are planning to get a Victory Royale in Fortnite , knowing where to find friendly characters on the island could be crucial. This guide will show gamers where they can go in order to find every friendly non-playable character on the Chapter 6 Season 4 map.

Friendly Character Locations and Services in Fortnite

Chapter 6 Season 4 NPC Map

Friendly NPCs provide useful services that can greatly aid players during a match. Here are all the friendly NPCs in Fortnite and what they have to offer:

Collection number

Location

Available services

  • Provides O.X.R. Patch Up service (requires Military Rank B)
  • Activates Rift to Go (requires Military Rank A)

  • Available for hire as a Medic Specialist (600 gold bars)
